Description: Papyrus (two fragments) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (30 ll.) and list of witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Agreement between kherhebs (lectors) of a cemetery with reference to the embalming of a deceased person. Date. year 24 Payni 15 of Ptol. Philometor = BC. 157. July 14".
Curator's comments: Dated to 14 July 157 BC, the scribe Harekusis of Asyut wrote this agreement in demotic between two groups of mortuary priests concerning the provision of cloth to individuals performing different operations during the mummification ritual. The verso has a list of the names of four witnesses. Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 193
Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. (Not from Darb el Gherza = Philadephia in Thompson's MS)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2739) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2739)
Shore & Smith 1960 / A Demotic embalmers' agreement (Pap. dem. B.M. 10561)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
